Keywords: Armor , Cosmic , Masters of Evil , Robot , Ruler
Real Name: Vision
Special Powers
YOU WILL NOT STOP ME FROM DOING WHAT IS NECESSARY: Stealth. // At the beginning of the game, each opponent must give an Infinity Gem token to 6 distinct characters on their starting force. If they have less than 6 characters, excess tokens must be given to one or more characters. // When Ultron Infinity hits one or more characters with an Infinity Gem token, instead of normal damage, you may choose to remove one hit character's Infinity Gem Token to roll a d6 to gain MISSION POINTS equal to the result.

RockyRaccoon
[QUOTE=OldManHowlett;12199514]I might be in the minority but I love how this guy plays. It's not perfect but it's an alternate take on a big bad boss character. If you don't stop him in time he just wins? That's awesome and I'd love for more figures to do similar stuff. People look at him like he's meant to represent Ultron with the gems already, but that's so version is too powerful so they gave us an ultron that can collect the gems and then just wins, which is actually pretty accurate.[/QUOTE] Thatï¿½d be fine but tbh the sculpt shows him already having the gems so because of that, itï¿½s a bit confusing. Idk, I was really really hoping weï¿½d get another powerful tentpole that could make legacy Thanos quiver in fear but instead we got a lame mission point character and I personally donï¿½t even like mission points. Heï¿½s also pretty easy to KO, and thereï¿½s nothing special about him. Personally, Iï¿½m pretty let down by this and I honestly feel like heï¿½s the worst chase.
June 14, 2022
Oathful
I want to like this Ultron, but looking at others that we've got in previous sets recently I just can't make to much of an argument for him. #053a Ultron from Empyre, while having slightly lower stats, can generate Ultron Drones and transforms into the very powerful #053b Ultron Pym, giving him a lot more utility for the team he's on and a very long lasting dial. It doesn't even seem fair to compare him to #074 Ultron from CAAV, who is one of the best Ultrons we've ever gotten. For 25 points more than Ultron Infinity you get everything this guy provides and then some, with an even longer lasting dial with the stop clicks. I would only get this Ultron (who is the 2nd most expensive one short of Ultron Pym) if you like collecting robots, but even then I won't be fielding him over my other Ultrons. Thematic: 6/10 Viability: 6/10 Fun Factor: 6.5/10, leans towards casual

This was a different scenario, with TV shows released across a year and WK being able to see 3 of the 4 shows fully. In any case, WK doesn't need to watch a show to know how to create a gauntlet wielding menace. Clearly WK chose to make this a MP Character rather than OMA figure. It's a choice that could have been made even if they saw the show.
